discussion.p:
Per /9, since the operand isn't nullptr and operand->type() == typeid(T) (because T = void in this case), we should return a pointer to the object contained by operand. But there is no such object.
We need to handle the T = void case, probably by just explicitly returning nullptr.
discussion.note: 2019-11 Priority to 2 during Monday issue prioritization in Belfast. There is implementation divergence here.
2020-02 Discussion in Prague did not reach consensus. Status to Open.
discussion.p: There was discussion about whether or not any_cast<void>(a) should be ill-formed, or return nullptr.
discussion.note: 2022-02 Currently ill-formed in MSVC ("error C2338: std::any cannot contain void") and returns null pointer in libstdc++ and libc++.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4835.
